alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:16AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Marshall, Fayette and eastern Shelby Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 316 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eads, or 7 miles east of Cordova, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Collierville, Germantown, Cordova, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Somerville, Mt Pleasant, Eads, Warren, Macon, Oakland, Piperton, Gallaway, Rossville, Moscow, Williston, Braden and Lenow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
